author: Staff Reporter
text:
Six child workers from Andhra Pradesh, who were on their way to work at a garment manufacturing company in Tirupur, were rescued by flying squad here on Thursday.

The squad intercepted a jeep near Government Arts College for Men and found six girls less than 18 years in the vehicle.

When inquired, they gave suspicious information. Hence, the officials informed the Child Welfare Committee and they were taken to the office.

Permission

Inquiries revealed that they were native of Belgaum village in Kuppam district in Andhra Pradesh and were on their way for work in Tirupur. Middlemen Kasi (45) of the same village said that permission was obtained from the girls’ parents for work.

The driver, Ramar (43) of Chennai, was also questioned.

The girls were rescued and sent to a home in Dharmapuri. The officials said that the girls’ parents were informed and they were on their way. After inquiry, the children would be send with them, they added.
title: Six child workers rescued
